title: Valmiki
summary: Valmiki (/vɑːlˈmiːki/;[1] Sanskrit: वाल्मीकि, Vālmīki [ʋɑːlmiːki])[upper-alpha 1] is celebrated as the harbinger-poet in Sanskrit literature.[2] The epic Ramayana, dated variously from the 5th century BCE[4][5] to first century BCE,[6] is attributed to him, based on the attribution in the text itself.[7] He is revered as Ādi Kavi, the first poet, author of Ramayana, the first epic poem.
